Package Services

Class MapService

java.lang.Object
Services.MapService
public class MapService extends Object
The MapService class is used to load, read, parse, edit and the save map file.
Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Navjot Kamboj, Pranjalesh Ghansiyal, Yatish Chutani

    • MapService

      public MapService()

  • Method Details

    • mapLoad

      public Map mapLoad(GameState p_gameState, String p_mapFileName)
      This method processes the map file.
      Parameters:
      p_gameState - this is the current state of the game
      p_mapFileName - this is the map file name
      Returns:
      Map object after processing the map file.

    • retrieveMetaData

      public List<String> retrieveMetaData(List<String> p_fileLines, String p_switchCaseParameter)
      This method retrieves the corresponding map file lines.
      Parameters:
      p_fileLines - this tells about the lines in the map document
      p_switchCaseParameter - the type of lines needed : country, continent, borders
      Returns:
      the list of required sets of lines

    • loadContinentsMetaData

      public List<Continent> loadContinentsMetaData(List<String> p_listOfContinents)
      This method loads the extracted continent data of the map file.
      Parameters:
      p_listOfContinents - this includes a list of continent's data from map file.
      Returns:
      a list of processed continent's meta data.

    • loadCountriesMetaData

      public List<Country> loadCountriesMetaData(List<String> p_listOfCountries)
      This method loads the extracted border and country data of the map file.
      Parameters:
      p_listOfCountries - this includes a list of country's data from map file.
      Returns:
      a list of processed country's meta data.

    • loadBorderMetaData

      public List<Country> loadBorderMetaData(List<Country> p_listOfCountries, List<String> p_listOfBorders)
      this method links the country's objects to their respective neighbors.
      Parameters:
      p_listOfCountries - this includes a list of country's data from map file
      p_listOfBorders - this includes a list of border's data from map file
      Returns:
      a list of updated Country Objects

    • connectContinentsCountry

      public List<Continent> connectContinentsCountry(List<Country> p_countries, List<Continent> p_continents)
      this method connects countries to the respective continents and sets them in object of continent.
      Parameters:
      p_countries - this is the total Country Objects
      p_continents - this is the total Continent Objects
      Returns:
      a list of updated continents

    • mapFile

      public List<String> mapFile(String p_mapFileName)
      This method loads and reads the map file.
      Parameters:
      p_mapFileName - Name of the map file
      Returns:
      All the lines in List from the map file.

    • mapModify

      public void mapModify(GameState p_gameState, String p_editMapPath) throws IOException
      The method is tasked with generating a new map in case the map to be edited does not exist. If the map already exists, it processes the map file into a game state object.
      Parameters:
      p_gameState - Current state of the game.
      p_editMapPath - contains the filepath.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • mapSave

      public boolean mapSave(GameState p_gameState, String p_mapFileName) throws InvalidMap
      It processes the revised map into a .map file and saves it to the specified destination.
      Parameters:
      p_gameState - Current gamestate
      p_mapFileName - file name in which map data is stored.
      Returns:
      true/false according to the success/failure of map save operation.
      Throws:
      InvalidMap - Invalid Map exception.

    • mapReset

      public void mapReset(GameState p_gameState)
      Resets Game State Map.
      Parameters:
      p_gameState - object of GameState.

    • addOrRemoveContinents

      public Map addOrRemoveContinents(Map p_mapToBeModified, String p_operationType, String p_argument) throws InvalidMap
      Method to modify Map based on the operation type ( add/remove) and arguments
      Parameters:
      p_mapToBeModified - Map under modification
      p_operationType - Add/Remove operation
      p_argument - Arguments
      Returns:
      Map object with updated continents
      Throws:
      InvalidMap - exception

    • modifyContinent

      public void modifyContinent(GameState p_gameState, String p_argument, String p_operationType) throws IOException, InvalidMap
      Method for modifying a chosen map by adding or removing continents using commands within the editmap function
      Parameters:
      p_gameState - Gamestate model class object
      p_argument - Arguments provided for the command operation
      p_operationType - Add/remove type operation
      Throws:
      IOException - given when the filename is not valid / it doesn't exist.
      InvalidMap - Exception

    • addOrRemoveCountry

      public Map addOrRemoveCountry(Map p_mapToBeModified, String p_operationType, String p_argument) throws InvalidMap
      Method to add/remove countries in the map
      Parameters:
      p_mapToBeModified - Map to be modified
      p_operationType - Add/Remove type operation
      p_argument - Arguments provided for the command operation
      Returns:
      Modified map object
      Throws:
      InvalidMap

    • modifyCountry

      public void modifyCountry(GameState p_gameState, String p_operation, String p_argument) throws InvalidMap
      Method to control modify country command flow i.e. to Add/Remove a country
      Parameters:
      p_gameState - Gamestate model class object
      p_operation - Add/Remove operation
      p_argument - Arguments provided for the command operation
      Throws:
      InvalidMap - exception

    • addOrRemoveNeighbor

      public Map addOrRemoveNeighbor(Map p_mapToBeModified, String p_operationType, String p_argument) throws InvalidMap
      Method to add/remove neighbor on Map object
      Parameters:
      p_mapToBeModified - Map object to be modified
      p_operationType - Add/remove operation
      p_argument - Arguments provided for the command operation
      Returns:
      modified map object
      Throws:
      InvalidMap - exception

    • modifyNeighbor

      public void modifyNeighbor(GameState p_gameState, String p_operation, String p_argument) throws InvalidMap
      Method for modifying a chosen map by adding or removing neighbors using commands
      Parameters:
      p_gameState - Gamestate object
      p_operation - Add/Remove operation type
      p_argument - Arguments provided for the command operation
      Throws:
      InvalidMap - exception
